intro: Canbya aurea, commonly known as the golden canbya, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine, soft hairs. Canbya aurea is often found in wetlands and along the edges of ponds, where it thrives in moist, sandy soils.
